alert.note: Alert for Cherokee (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 04 at 1:51PM EST until January 05 at 1:23AM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Peachtree City GA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Georgia... Oostanaula River at US 27 at Rome affecting Floyd County. Etowah River at Canton affecting Cherokee County. For the Oostanaula River Basin...including Resaca, Calhoun, Calhoun, Armuchee, Rome, Rome, Rome, Rome...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Etowah River Basin...including Landrum, Russell Creek downstream of Head Lake Dawsonville, Dawsonville, Dawsonville, Dawsonville, Matt, Ball Ground, Canton, Old GA 5 below Ball Ground, Canton, Canton, Waleska, Woodstock, Noonday Creek above Chastain Meadows Pkwy Marietta, Woodstock, Woodstock, Kennesaw, Acworth, Allatoona Dam above Cartersville, Rockmart, Cartersville, Dallas, Kingston, Kingston, Rome, Rome...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Etowah River at Canton. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 16 feet, Flood Stage is reached. Minor flooding begins in the woodlands and fields along the river upstream and downstream from the gage by the Walaska Street bridge. Low lying portions of recreational areas such as Boling Park behind the Cherokee County High School...the Cherokee County Fairgrounds and the Etowah River Greenway at Heritage Park will begin to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:15 PM EST Wednesday the stage was 15.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this afternoon to a crest of 16.3 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage this evening. - Flood stage is 16 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
